intro: Eustoma russellianum f. album, commonly known as the white lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental plants. Its delicate appearance and long-lasting blooms make it a valuable addition to both floral arrangements and garden landscapes.
